oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Jim Reeves tribute and interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of a tribute message and interview with Jim Reeves (performer) and Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Biff Collie talks about losing Jim Reeves, and how we should be thankful for his life and work -- (01:37) Jim Reeves talks about how he wanted to be a country singer all his life before it finally happened -- (02:16) Reeves says to all aspiring country artists, keep singing and keep cutting records -- (02:41) Reeves talks about his greatest inspiration being Jimmie Rodgers, and how eventually he became Carrie Rodgers friend -- (03:23) Reeves talks about Horace Logan giving him his first job in radio, eventually leading to singing on the Louisiana Hayride, as well as his first record label manager -- (04:07) Reeves talks about having loyal fans -- (05:10) Reeves talks about his recording ""He'll Have To Go"" -- He'll Have To Go (Jim Reeves) [recorded excerpt] -- (08:00) Reeves talks about golfing and hunting -- (08:56) Reeves talks about not being a picky eater, and eating pancakes for breakfast and fried chicken for lunch -- (09:26) Reeves talks about how important the Grand Ole Opry, being the worlds longest running radio program -- (10:11) Reeves talks about the fellowship between artist at the GOO and WSM radio -- (11:05) Reeves talks about never playing a bad or poorly attended show in San Antonio -- [Unidentified] concludes the interview and thanks Reeves -- (12:05) Biff introduces Jim Reeves -- Reeves talks about making his first record -- (12:40) Reeves talks about not being discouraged when his first record didn't set the world on fire -- (13:10) Reeves talks about making barely any sales on that first record, but his next record when number one -- (13:37) Reeves talks about wanting to be a baseball player as a child, and playing for the St. Louis Cardinals -- (14:14) Reeves talks about working in radio for seven years -- (14:25) Reeves talks about wanting to get back into the radio business -- (15:00) Reeves talks about when he might retire, and tells Biff a fishing story -- Collie concludes the interview
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Reeves, Jim; Collie, Biff;
